title: Exponential Distribution
text: Let T equal the time elapsed between calls. From part a, the mean is found to be $$0.25$$, so the decay parameter is $$1$$ divided by the mean, $$0.25$$.
speech: Let T equal the time elapsed between calls. From part a, the mean is found to be , 0.25 , so the decay parameter is  1  divided by the mean,  0.25; .

title: Exponential Distribution
text: We want to find the area under the exponential distiributiion function where T is less than the $$t=\frac{1}{6}$$ minutes boundary.
speech: We want to find the area under the exponential distiributiion function where T is less than the , t is equal to 1 sixth,  minutes boundary.

title: Exponential Distribution
text: The probability that the next call occurs in less than $$10$$ seconds (where $$10$$ seconds is equal to $$\frac{1}{6}$$ minutes) is $$P\left(T<\frac{1}{6}\right)=1-e^{\left(-4t\right)}$$, where $$t$$ is $$\frac{1}{6}$$.\n##figure1.gif##
speech: The probability that the next call occurs in less than ; 10  seconds (where  10  seconds is equal to  1 sixth  minutes) is ;  cap p, open paren,  cap t is less than 1 sixth, close paren; is equal to; 1 minus; e raised to the open paren negative 4 t, close paren power; , where  t  is  1 sixth; .\n##figure1.gif##
